name: Universe Engine
description: I worked on the in-house game engine of Virtual Arts during an internship. My goal was to improve performance and fix rendering bugs with their Metal and Vulkan implementations

name: ScanRig
description: ScanRig is a tool built with AliceVision to achieve high-quality photogrammetry at low-budget. You place your object in the center, and 3 cameras will turn around and take pictures of it

name: Chaos Dashboard
description: A data-visualisation website about the worst kind of events of the year. There are little games, demons and all sort of jokes. This nightmare-ish design was integrated with React

name: A Rogue Like
description: A simple endless 3D fight game made with procedural dungeon generation. It runs with Unreal Engine, we took free assets from its stores and animations from Mixamo

name: The Last Call
description: A title sequence for an original movie. I modelled and textured the robot, and took Megascan assets in Unreal Engine for the universe. We took some motion-capture animations from Mixamo and applied modifications to them

name: A Snowpiercer Scene
description: A small scene made with Blender about the Snowpiercer movie. It is rendered in realtime to try out the power of the Evee renderer

name: Learn Vulkan
description: A custom renderer made to learn and test Vulkan concepts. It uses a lot of Object-Oriented-Programming to better understand the relationship between vulkan objects

name: Cube Beast Editor
description: A voxel-editor running on your desktop and your browser. The renderer is OpenGL, but it builds in WebAssembly which converts calls to WebGL

name: Met ECS
description: An Entity-Component-System library in C++ made to test out the templating langage. Its API is based on the entt library to compare performance easily

name: Mirrors Lasers & Robots
description: A small tower-defense game with made in C++ with an Entity Component System architecture. It renders with OpenGL but we use Microsoft's XAML through Noesis GUI for the user interface

name: OpenGL Playground
description: A simple OpenGL renderer with an Entity Component System architecture. Can run on your browser as it support WebAssembly builds

name: DirectX 11 Playground
description: A simple DirectX 11 renderer with an Entity Component System architecture

name: Lolimac
description: Lolimac is an event-organisation website made with Angular. You can create, modify and join events made for IMAC students. Synchronisation with calendars is available as well

name: Which GUI
description: Adaptation of great user interfaces in games using different technologies. It compares web frameworks (Angular, Vue, React), game engines (Unreal, Godot, Unity) and QT philosophy

name: Roll Goal
description: Re-creation of a small game across multiple game engines. Now using Unity (both in ECS and GameObject), Unreal Engine and Godot

name: Coffee Conspiration
description: A parody website built with webpack and HTML Components. It is a game/story experience dedicated to surprise its audience and play with conspiration tropes

name: Portal Box
description: A puzzle-box built when I applied for my engineering school. You have to resolve a combination with two potentiometer in order to open the box

name: L'Ã©choppe de Ben
description: Point'n click game made with Unity for the Digital Art Jam 2. You visit the small chop made by the Artist Ben Vautier and try to discover its secrets

name: Infotrafic.com
description: A realtime-trafic map visualizer made for my employer Infotrafic. It is built with Angular and uses Node.js as backend. Uses progressive web app (PWA) structure and conventions

name: Kanaga Wave
description: A 1 vs 1 game made in Unity during the Global Game Jam 2017. You have to jump in rythm to make big waves in order to overflow your opponent on the other island
